JOJF-DTV
Yamanashi Prefecture
Japan
Branding YBS
Channels Digital: 25 (UHF)
Virtual: 4
Affiliations Nippon News Network
Owner Yamanashi Broadcasting System Inc.
Founded July 1, 1954
First air date December 20, 1959
Call letters' meaning Japan/Mount Fuji
Former channel number(s) 5 (analog VHF, 1959–2011)
Website www.ybs.jp
Yamanashi Broadcasting System Headquarters, Kofu, Yamanashi designed by Kenzō Tange

Yamanashi Broadcasting System (株式会社山梨放送, Kabushiki-gaisha Yamanashi Hōsō), also known as YBS, is a Japanese broadcast network affiliated with Nippon News Network (NNN). Its headquarters is located in Kōfu, Yamanashi.

Contents

  • 1 Network
  • 2 Stations
    • 2.1 Digital TV(ID:4)
    • 2.2 Radio
  • 3 Programs
    • 3.1 Radio
    • 3.2 TV
  • 4 Rival Stations
    • 4.1 Radio
    • 4.2 TV
  • 5 LINK

Network[edit]

  • TV: Nippon News Network (NNN)
  • RADIO: Japan Radio Network (JRN), National Radio Network (NRN)

Stations[edit]

Digital TV(ID:4)[edit]

  • Kōfu JOJF-DTV 25ch

Radio[edit]

  • Kōfu JOJF 765kHz; 90.9 MHz FM

Programs[edit]

Radio[edit]

  • YBS Radio news(YBSラジオニュース)
  • YBS News up(YBSニュースアップ)
  • YBS News halftime(YBSニュースハーフタイム)
  • 765morning
  • 765Music Express(765MUX)
  • FUN TAME(ふぁん★タメ)
  • Shoko Sawada's Saturday Jamboree(沢田聖子のサタデージャンボリー)
  • RADIUS(ラヂウス)
  • Yukko's POPSAT(ゆっこのポプサタ)
  • DIG THE MUSIC
  • FREE STYLE
  • Hanchingu(はんちんぐ)

TV[edit]

  • YBS News(YBSニュース)
  • YBS Wide News(YBSワイドニュース)
  • YBS Midnight News(YBSニュース深夜便)
  • Tomo-chan chi no goji(ともちゃん家の5時)
  • VENT Spo!(VENTスポ!)
  • Kurayami de aimasho(暗闇で逢いましょう)
  • Yamanashi genki navi(やまなし元気ナビ)


Rival Stations[edit]

Radio[edit]

  • FM Fuji(エフエム富士) - independent, formerly of JFN

TV[edit]

  • UHF Television Yamanashi(UTY,テレビ山梨) - JNN

LINK[edit]

  • Yamanashi Broadcasting System
